text: Tried this place in Singapore and it was really good! The soup was flavourful, ingredients were fresh, and portions were generous. Loved the suan cai fish and tomato soup. Comes with rice, side dishes, and tea. Will come back again!

Totally lost own appetite. Luckily came across at this sour & spicy Chinese eatery. And there was a friendly staff who sat down & took orders for each table of customer. Yes, snapper fish is always nice to eat for my case. The soup was so refreshing ğŸ˜‹

I had the suan cai fish here and it was delicious! The portion size is generous and you can easily adjust the spice level to your preference which is a great touch. The staff is incredibly friendly and provides excellent service. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves suan cai fish. Will definitely be back!

Their signature suan cai soup base. Itâ€™s not overly sour nor oily. You can choose to top up ingredients like vege, mushrooms, meat etc. Their original soup comes with black fungus, bamboo shoots and glass noodles. We picked grouper to go with this soup base. Personally felt the grouper is a bit overcooked and dry for our liking tho

Hidden gem found! Newly opened in Aug/Sep 2024 (previously Japanese Ramen place) by the same boss. Highly recommend the cold cucumber appetizer, and fried pork strips! Also tried the noodles, comes with rich soup and fresh fish chunks! Thereâ€™s free flow of side dishes like braised peanuts and pickled vegetables. Service is very friendly! Will return for more!
